entry.title: "Lumbar Jack" Mattress Supporter
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dream Designs Co. Ltd. (Tax ID: 133893164)
Type: mattress
Price: 89.00 - 169.00 (2 variants)

Relieve back pain naturally by adding support to your mattress under the lumbar region. Works well for back, side, and stomach sleepers, and accommodates different body types.

Designed and Made in Canada by Dream Designs from solid wood and natural cotton canvas. First launched on February 5, 2020.

Design Considerations:

Due to the uneven weight distribution of the human body, gravity will cause any mattress to compress the most around the lumbar region. Inadequate support will cause the spine to compress, shoulders to close in, and irritate the nervous system, resulting in pain, numbness, and tingling/prickling sensations on your back and limbs. The physical discomfort will reduce the quality of your sleep and diminish your overall health and quality of life.

To alleviate back pain, "sleep experts" typically advise consumers to replace their entire mattress every 7-10 years, which is not only ineffective but also extremely wasteful and harmful to the environment. The same problem will soon happen to the new mattress. With a "Lumbar Jack" Mattress Supporter, your back will feel better and you'll never need to buy another mattress.

User Instructions:

Place the "Lumbar Jack" under a mattress or a mattress topper. Position along the spine to suit your preference. It can be placed on box springs, bed slats, or another mattress. It can also be used on an adjustable bed base or a hospital bed.

Measurements:

Our "Lumbar Jack" Mattress Supporter measures 24" long by 20" wide and is designed to be used by one person. It can be folded into 5"x2.5"x24" for easy travelling.

s:variant.title: Single
Set of Two

entry.title: La Luna Modular Mattress
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dream Designs
Type: mattress
Price: 759.00 - 6428.00 (88 variants)

Made in Vancouver, Canada, from organic cotton, Dunlop latex, and recycled wool. 100% premium organic natural materials to ensure a clean and healthy home.  
  

100% Organic Natural 
Healthy Materials 
- No VOC/EMF exposures
  
         
  
  • Superior comfort
  • Sustainable
  • Made in Canada
  • 120-Day Home Trial
  • Lifetime Warranty 
    		•

    Unlike most mattresses, La Luna beds do not contain any petrochemical foams and toxic chemicals that pollute indoor air or metal springs that disrupt the sleep cycle.

    To achieve the most comfortable natural sleep, we use certified organic cotton for its calming softness and breathability, Dunlop latex foam for its unrivalled support and longevity, and melton wool for its flame retardancy and structural strength.  

    Organic Cotton Dunlop Latex  Melton Wool
    certified by GOTS, Oeko Tex 100
    certified by ECO, GOLS, Oeko Tex 100
    80% recycled wool/20% viscose

      

    La Luna's unique modular design allows each sleeper to personalize firmness, eliminate disturbances, and stack additional modules to enhance comfort and support.          

     

     

    Personalized Firmness

    Isolated Motion
    The latex modules are made from 3" thick, odourless, hypoallergenic, pure Dunlop latex foams and encased in a heavyweight, tightly woven molten wool fabric casing, which not only serves as a flame retardant but also adds surface structure to minimize sinking. Their superior support provides exceptional tension relief, allowing the body to relax in perfect alignment.  The optional 1" thick organic cotton topper made from organic cotton batting, organic cotton canvas, and a wool wrap, provides pillowy softness and enhanced breathability.   

    Deep Relaxation

    Breathable and Dry 

    Sleeping on a La Luna feels very much like floating on stillwater - your tension and stress dissolves, your nerves relax, your mind slows, and you doze into a deeply calming, restful sleep.

    Choose your La Luna  

    La Luna beds are available in 3", 6", 9", and 12" thickness and three levels of firmness: soft (excl. 3"), medium, and firm.  Your age and body mass index (BMI) are the two most important factors to consider when choosing the right mattress.  Please click the charts on the left to see which La Luna models are recommended for you. Only Queen and King sizes have two halves, as shown in the photos.

    When in doubt, we recommend starting with a 3" or 6" model and gradually add more modules to increase thickness and support. Registered La Luna customers are eligible to purchase additional modules of the same size at a 10% discount after the trial period of the initial purchase ends.

    Use and Care  

    Your La Luna bed should be placed on a flat, level, and well-supported base, such as the slats of a platform bed frame, a box spring, or another mattress.  If placed on slats, the gaps between slats should not exceed 1.5".  Please flip and rotate the "La Luna" at least once a year to even out the natural compression.  

    Please cover your La Luna mattress with a fitted sheet to keep it clean.  If the La Luna bed is stained, you can spot clean it with a damp cloth and let it air dry thoroughly. Please do not remove the cover to wash it in water because it may shrink and deform.

    Please ensure your sleeping space is dry and well ventilated.  Even though wool and latex have antimicrobial properties, if placed in damp areas for an extended period, they can become mouldy. 

    Shipping and Handling 

    Orders are generally shipped within two weeks. Each La Luna module is individually packaged and easy for one person to handle and move. Shipping is free to all Canadian metro areas.  Remote areas may be subject to delivery charges.  Vancouver customers can either pick up their mattress from our warehouse or have it delivered for free on Saturdays.  

    Lifetime Warranty 

    We provide the original owner/purchaser of a La Luna Mattress with a lifetime warranty against material and workpersonship defects. We will either repair the defect or replace the defective module at our discretion with a comparable item. To start a warranty claim, the original owner/purchaser must contact us by email with the original proof of purchase.

    This warranty does not cover normal wear and tear, improper use, and damages caused by the users, children, and animals. Eligible defects include 1) visible compression or sag of the mattress greater than one inch from structural failure, and 2) during the first ten years, fabric tearing, stitch unravelling, and zipper breakage of the fabric cover due to material flaw and production error.

    After ten years from the date of purchase, while keeping the original mattress, the owner/purchaser is eligible to purchase a replacement mattress of the same type and size at 25% discount. 

    Chemical Sensitivities 

    Although our products are made of hypoallergenic natural materials, we do not guarantee that they are scent-free or warrant against allergies and chemical sensitivities.  The materials we use have faint natural scents that do not bother most people and will dissipate with time.  They were produced with little or no input of chemicals.  If you are concerned about allergies, please consult your physician and purchase a material sample kit to test the materials beforehand.   

    Shipping to the United States 

    Our mattresses can only be sold in Canada.  The US has stricter flammability standards which require the use of potentially toxic petrochemicals.  Exceptions can be made with a doctor's prescription for non-CFR 1633 compliant mattress.  For more information, visit www.peopleforcleanbeds.org.

entry.title: "Dream Bed" Cotton Mattresses & Topper (Sold Separately)
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dream Designs
Type: mattress
Price: 409.00 - 1949.00 (40 variants)

  • Organic or natural cotton casing fabric and batting provides supreme comfort and breathability;
  • High-density hypoallergenic foam provides firm support and longevity;
  • Natural wool wrap instead of toxic chemicals used as fire retardant;
  • No metal springs or other metal components that may amplify surrounding electromagnetic radiations;
  • Over time the mattress compresses to conform to the contour of your body; 
  • Life expectancy 8+ years;
  • Quality made in Canada since 1981.

A Tradition of Quality

Dream Designs, originally known as Dream Futon, started making futon-style mattresses in 1981.  Late owner, Irma McInnis, who used to sew the futons herself, once explained how the company got its start.  "When a girlfriend talked about the cotton mattresses in Israel, I wanted to find out more.  At that time polyester was "in" and you couldn't even find cotton underwear!  I saw an opportunity to make natural textiles a part of people's everyday lives, to make healthy 'sleep pods' with no metal springs and no electromagnetic discharge.  Futons are a simple, pure design that affords people a rejuvenating sleep."

Today, Dream Designs' mattresses are known as Dream Beds, though each mattress is still handmade one at a time with the same attention to detail that Irma instilled over thirty years ago.  Through the years these mattresses have acquired a loyal following of customers who enjoy the comfort, craftsmanship, and durability of Dream Beds.

Natural Comfort

The Dream Bed is filled with your choice of natural or organic cotton batting and hypoallergenic, biodegradable, polyurethane foam.  The foam we use is manufactured locally in the Greater Vancouver area at sea level and includes natural vegetable oils such as soy and is safe to use.  The layers of cotton batting and high-density foam are then wrapped with a layer of wool which meets Canadian fire retardant requirements, but also wicks away moisture, equalizes temperature and humidity, deters dust mites from inhibiting the mattress, and provides additional cushioning comfort.  Dream Beds are cased in a premium unbleached natural cotton or organic cotton casing and finished with tufting by hand throughout to prevent the materials from shifting inside.  

  • Minimalist mattress - made of organic or natural cotton batting, 1 layer of 1" high-density foam, and cased in either organic or natural cotton.  Firm, compact, and easy to move.  3" in thickness.
  • Deluxe mattress - made of organic or natural cotton batting, 2 layers of 1" high-density foam, and cased in either organic or natural cotton.  It is better suited for those who prefer a softer mattress.  6" in thickness.
  • Supreme mattress -made of organic or natural cotton batting, 3 layers of 1" high-density foam, and cased in either organic or natural cotton. It is better suited for those who prefer their mattresses firm.  6" in thickness.
  • Mattress topper - made of organic or natural cotton batting, wrapped in wool, and cased in either organic or natural cotton.  It can either be used as a topper to add comfort and breathability to a mattress or on its own on a Japanese tatami mat.  2" thick in thickness.
  • Mattress pad - Same construction as our mattress topper, but only 1" thick.  An ideal pairing for our latex mattresses. 
The Dream Bed Experience

Sleeping on a Dream Bed is like sleeping on a dense cloud of cotton.  It is soft yet supportive and promotes totally restful sleep.  Unlike conventional spring mattresses, there are no metals inside of the Dream Bed, which means no squeaking sound, bouncing motion, or electromagnetic output.  Unlike foam mattresses, our mattresses do not trap heat, but naturally regulates temperature by allowing air to pass through.

The Dream Bed has a recommended lifespan of 8+ years depending on usage, although some customers have told us they've used their beds for over 15 years! When you suffer from deteriorating comfort and diminished support, it's time to shop for a new bed.    

Use and Care

The Dream Bed should be either placed directly on the slats of a platform bed frame or on top of a box spring to ensure air ventilation.  It is necessary to flip and rotate the Dream Bed periodically to even out the compression.  Please clean the Dream Bed by spot clean with a damp cloth and thorough air dry.

Shipping

Shipping is free to all Canadian metro areas. Due to size restrictions, We are currently not shipping Queen and King Deluxe and Supreme mattresses to areas outside of the Greater Vancouver region. Vancouver customers can either pick up their mattress from our warehouse or have it delivered for free on Saturdays.  

Our mattresses can only be sold in Canada.  The US has stricter flammability standards which require the use of potentially toxic petrochemicals.  Exceptions can be made with a doctor's prescription for non-CFR 1633 compliant mattress.  For more information, visit www.peopleforcleanbeds.org.

entry.title: Latex Mattress for babies
entry.summary:
Vendor: Dream Designs
Type:
Price: 599.00

100% natural Dunlop Rubber Latex Gold mattresses, built to provide a safe, healthy, and long lasting sleeping environment.  Made in Vancouver, Canada.

  • 4" firm density natural latex core for Crib size
  • for twin and larger, 6" medium density natural latex core, firm on one side and soft on the other
  • organic cotton knit zipped-on cover
  • 100% pure New Zealand wool comfort layer
  • no metal spring coils
  • pincore latex design for superior air circulation
  • non allergenic/natural antibacterial properties
  • no toxic off-gassing
  • dust free
  • longevity

s:variant.title: Crib
